content: faux mistake rib touque copyright © 2022 mary westland ~ aunt zany ~ auntzany@gmail com faux mistake rib touque was inspired by several other fun crochet hat patterns and has been updated with techniques learned from slip_stitch crochet designer lyudmila hefny this iteration of the hat was designed to complement northmoor watchcaps a knitted hat designed by luise o neill faux mistake and northmoor were chosen for the august 22 hal for the hats for sailors ravelry group as this hat is crocheted side-to-side in narrow wedges it s easy to adapt to whatever size you wish to crochet with whatever yarn you choose as designed the hat is extra tall to allow for a generous turn-up of the brim but it can easily be adapted to a single layer beanie style by just reducing the number of stitches in the hatband and/or body this hat looks great in a solid color or in a long self- striping yarn short color-break variegated yarns might work but can be overwhelming figures and chart can be found at the end of the document where it s easy for you to decide whether or not to print them materials sample yarn cloudborn superwash highland worsted ocean 250 yds crochet hook size #7 4 5mm or whatever size you need for your preferred yarn and gauge tapestry needle stitch markers gauge #4 worsted weight with #7 4 5mm hook 16 sts = 4 in single_crochet blo ribbing finished size sample hat adult large worsted weight 23 x 12 with hatband unfolded abbreviations & special stitches rs = right side ws = wrong side pm = place marker rem = remain blo = back loop only flo = front loop only st s = stitch es yo = yarn over chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet tch = turning chain not included in stitch counts in this pattern = work all stitches inside parentheses in one stitch as indicated = indicates a repeating stitch pattern to be worked over the indicated number of stitches tch bump turning chain bump isn t actually the back bump of the turning chain but its back loop some short row connector stitches are worked thru this bump and some require inserting the hook thru this bump and the adjacent strand the actual back bump of the turning chain fig 2a faux mistake rib touque © 2022 ~ aunt zany ~ 7/18/2022 ~ page 1 of 7 xpl pl-single_crochet pick up 1 loop single_crochet connector insert hook in tch bump and blo of next stitch below yo and pull up a loop yo and pull thru everything fig 2 pl pl-slip_stitch pick up 1 loop slip_stitch connector insert hook in tch bump insert hook in blo of next stitch below yo and pull thru everything fig 2 pattern notes hat is worked side to side and seamed with slip_stitch crochet the crown is sewn closed with the long tail after seaming crown shaping
